B

beemanPtOne(PhysicsVector, double) - Method in class GravBody
Uses the 1st half of the Beeman algorithm to move a body forward by a time-step dt.
beemanPtTwo(PhysicsVector, PhysicsVector, double) - Method in class GravBody
Uses the 2nd half of the Beeman algorithm to calculate a body's velocity after it has been moved forward by a time-step dt.

C

calcConservation() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the conservation of mechanical energy and angular momentum of the system
calcGrav(GravBody) - Method in class GravBody
Returns the gravitational attraction of one body onto this body, using g = (Gm/r^2)r^ where g is the acceleration due to gravity, G is the Gravitational Constant, m is the mass of the other body, r is the displacement vector between the bodies, and r^ is the unit vector of this displacement vector
calcIntialEL() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the intial energy and angular momentum of the system
calcTotAngularMomentum() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the total angular momentum of the system by calculating the angular momentum of each body and summing togther.
calcTotBodyAcc(GravBody) - Method in class GravBody
Increases the total acceleration by the acceleration resulting from the gravitational attraction from the other body, using calcGrav.
calcTotEnergy() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the total energy of the system by using the calcTotKE and calcTotGPE methods.
calcTotGPE() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the total gravitational potential energy of the system by calculating the GPE of each body and summing them up.
calcTotKE() - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the total kinetic energy of the system by calculating the kinetic energy of each body and summing them up.
calcTotSystemAcc(ArrayList<GravBody>) - Method in class SolarSystem
Calculates the total acceleration of the system due to each of the bodies gravitational fields.
chooseAlgorithm(int) - Static method in class SolarSystemSim
Prompts user to choose which algorithm to use in the simulation

enterTimeStep(double) - Static method in class SolarSystemSim
Prompts the user to enter the time-step of the simulation
euler(double) - Method in class GravBody
Uses the Euler alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t)dt v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
eulerCramer(double) - Method in class GravBody
Uses the Euler-Cramer alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+dt)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
eulerRichardson(GravBody, double) - Method in class GravBody
Uses the Euler-Cramer algorithm with the velocity and acceleration from the mid-point of the iteration v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t+0.5t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+0.5t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the initial time of the iteration

GravBody - Class in <Unnamed>
Name: GravBody Purpose: To model a gravitational body that has mass, radius, position, velocity, a name and can be acted upon by other GravBodys
GravBody() - Constructor for class GravBody
Default constructor of GravBody.
GravBody(GravBody) - Constructor for class GravBody
Constructor of GravBody that copies a GravBody by setting every compenent to be the same as the GravBody to be copied.
GravBody(String, double, double, double, double, double, double, double, double) - Constructor for class GravBody
Constructor of GravBody that sets every component seperately.
GravBody(String, PhysicsVector, PhysicsVector, double, double) - Constructor for class GravBody
Constructor of GravBody that sets the position and velocity using PhysicsVectors.
GravField - Class in <Unnamed>
Name: GravField Purpose: To simulate the gravitational field of a body
GravField() - Constructor for class GravField
Default constructor of GravField that calculates g at the surface of a body with mass of 1, radius of 1, using: g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
GravField(double, double) - Constructor for class GravField
Produces a GravField of a body with mass M and radius R, and a g at the surface of the body, using: g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
GravField(double, double, PhysicsVector) - Constructor for class GravField
Constructs a GravField of a body with mass M and radius R and a g at a distance from the surface of r, using: g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
GravField(GravField) - Constructor for class GravField
Constructs a new GravField as a copy of an exsisting one, using: g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
GravField(PhysicsVector, double) - Constructor for class GravField
Constructs a GravField of a point object with mass m, with g calculated at a distance r, using g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated

P

PhysicsVector - Class in <Unnamed>
A 3-dimensional vector class to be used in the development of computer simulations of various physical systems.
PhysicsVector() - Constructor for class PhysicsVector
Default constructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude
PhysicsVector(double[]) - Constructor for class PhysicsVector
Constructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array.
PhysicsVector(double, double) - Constructor for class PhysicsVector
Constructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction and the second argument y giving the component in the j direction.
PhysicsVector(double, double, double) - Constructor for class PhysicsVector
Constructor that takes three arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argumentgiving the component in the i direction, the second argument giving the component in the j direction and the third argument giving the component in the k direction.
PhysicsVector(PhysicsVector) - Constructor for class PhysicsVector
Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.

setBody(PhysicsVector, PhysicsVector) - Method in class GravBody
Sets the body's position and velocity using PhysicsVectors
setGPE(GravBody) - Method in class GravBody
Sets the GPE of the body with respect to another body using GPE = -GMm/r Where G is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of the other body m is the mass of this body, r is the displacement vector between them.
setGrav(PhysicsVector) - Method in class GravField
Calculates the acceleration due to gravity at a point r from the surface of a body using g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
setKE() - Method in class GravBody
Sets the kinetic energy of the body using KE = 0.5*m*v^2

Sets the body's position components seperately
